website_summaries.verdict: This older version of the Kindle Paperwhite has some nice capabilities, but considering the price similarity, you may want to opt for the newer version and enjoy the updated features.
pros: The previous gen Paperwhite that offers 300 pixels-per-inch resolution, easy-to-carry 6-inch screen size, and built-in light
WiFi connectivity is reliable, and screen doesn't produce glare
Gets long battery life per charge
cons: Price is similar to the upgraded Paperwhite, yet this model doesn't include the latest features like waterproof build and mobile connectivity
Less storage capacity and no Audible access

website_summaries.verdict: The Kindle Paperwhite gets an HD screen, and while it isn't as big an upgrade as you'd think, it's a welcome addition, incrementally enhancing the Kindle reading experience.
pros: Amazon has improved on last year's excellent Paperwhite e-reader with the sharper, higher resolution screen found in the step-up Kindle Voyage
A smattering of new features enhance Amazon's already best-in-class content ecosystem
The built-in light isn't quite as good as the Voyage's, but it works well
cons: The HD screen is an upgrade but doesn't make a huge difference
an AC adapter isn't included (just a Micro-USB cable for charging).

customer_reviews.title: Light does not turn completely off
customer_reviews.text: Love the functionality, the screen resolution, and the overall reading experience. HATE the blue light. It does not turn completely off (it only can be turned down) and sometimes it gives me a headache. And come on Amazon. It's blue. BLUE. Melatonin disrupting BLUE. Irritate your sleeping partner BLUE. This is so close to a perfect product: beautiful engineering and then BOOB overlook the anatomy of the eye and the science of lighting. Such a physically uncomfortable and disappointing engineering failure.
customer_reviews.author: Turningleaves

customer_reviews.title: Known Issue: Paperwhite downloads remain QUEUED. No solution
customer_reviews.text: My content will not download from the Kindle Store and remains in QUEUED status for days until I cancel the downloads. Have contacted customer service multiple times and have searched for a solution online. Multiple resets and syncings performed. Apparently this is a known issue with the Paperwhites, but Amazon doesn't presently have a solution. How convenient that the "special offers" are able to sync just fine. It's just my paid content that doesn't make it through. Nothing like being sold a product that doesn't act a advertised. This is very disappointing considering Amazon is usually very attentive to their customers. Will happily change my review to reflect the fixed product once a solution is found.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great gift.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a Christmas present for my fiance. He does a lot of reading for work on the computer, but at night his laptop illuminates the whole room. The Kindle really does make a huge difference, and it's obviously much lighter than a computer.

customer_reviews.text: I would like to point out one thing. It says it has a week of battery life, honestly that really depends on how much you read. I read on it all the time, it takes me about 2 days before my battery is really low. Last month in April this scratch like thing appeared in the middle of my screen. customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kindle in April 2016. Today it froze and is completely locked up. The remaining solution is to buy a brand new one. I am deeply disappointed in the (lack of) quality in this product an the fact that Amazon will only offer me a 15% off discount. January 2018: customer service followed up with me and offered me a refurbished paper white for no charge. I accepted and it has performed perfectly. I am satisfied with the ultimate outcome of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: tp

customer_reviews.title: I am not disappointed! Reading is comfortable and seamless no matter what ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Kindle Paperwhite, and it served me well for years, but it was getting a bit slow on the responses and had a ding in the screen, so I decided to upgrade when Kindles were discounted. I am not disappointed! Reading is comfortable and seamless no matter what lighting I'm in with this reader. I love the font options and ability to connect to Goodreads, and since it's the same size as my old one, I was able to pop it straight into the cover case I already owned. Winning! I am sure this is a product which will last me years before needing replacement (and my old one still works just fine as a backup).

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience ever. infinite loop.
customer_reviews.text: This was good at beginning, but it got worst. At some point, it started rebooting again and again when I hit the power button. It asks me cancel, restart, or screen off. However, it doesn't matter, it reboots anyway. I sent this to Amazon to fix, and got back today. It still reboots. the worst device met worst support, kindle worst paper white. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: toanyone

customer_reviews.title: so slow on everything
customer_reviews.text: It was ok. But after two month use, it becomes so so so slow. Turning pages is fine. But if I ever need to open the dictionary, wiki, look up context, visit the store, or do anything other than turning the page. It takes at least FIVE seconds waiting time.. Is it even normal????? I mean, I know it's just a E-reader, not an iPad, but you would still expect it has basic processing power to support decent speed on searching and black and white display. I buy kindle to read, because it has no glare. At least it does that.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: The experience on this device is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't planning on posting a review. However, something happened that prompted me to go ahead and post a review of this amazing device. I was well into a nice space opera book on my Kindle Paperwhite when I caught myself talking, rather loudly, to the device in response to what was happening in the story within the book. It occurred to me at that moment that the Kindle had 'disappeared' and allowed me to immerse myself in the book so fully that I felt as if I were living inside the story rather than reading text on a screen. That is the defining mark of a good e-reader. Thank you, Amazon, you've made a new friend.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Ian MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: Not what it's cracked up to be.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd kindle. I didn't like either of them and never really used them. I thought this would be an improvement which it is. The problem is that I read for several hours at a time and as a consequence am having to charge it every other day not weeks. The other issue is that I do get glare on the screen unless it is held just right. I do like the size and weight of it and the huge selection of books. Despite it's flaws I will continue to use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: A must get. Far exceeds the iPad or any other reading device.
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking, do I really need this because I have my iPad and I can just read from there? WRONG. This is SO much better than reading off the iPad or just a regular book. I come across words all the time I don't know, and with a simple click, I can look up the definition and BOOM, my vocabulary has already expanded. Super light and easy to carry around. Don't have to worry about getting sand on it at the beach, or lugging around a heavy book. This is a life-changer in the book world.
customer_reviews.author: cc2

customer_reviews.title: I love my new Paper White Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Paper White Kindle. I was using a 5-year old Kindle Fire. The Fire, at 409 grams, is twice the weight of the Paper White. My wrist was starting to hurt from reading the Fire at night. My wrist feels so much better with the new Paper White. Also, I had to charge the fire nearly every other day. I have charged the paper white twice since I've owned it. And lastly, I couldn't read outside with the Fire. No problem with the Paper White. Of course with both readers I can read I the dark by the light of the E-reader and I have downloaded several books for 0.99$ to 1.99$.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Charge is not lasting
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy reading with this Paperwhite, can read while sitting outside which was the main reason I purchased it. However, after 8 months of enjoying the device it only holds a charge for around 5 hours! I bought this to read during the day while using my tablet to read at night. The charge never did last as long as advertised but I read a lot so was not unhappy about that but now I find myself charging it daily!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never run out of reading material again.
customer_reviews.text: I use my Kindle every day without fail. I really like having Kindle unlimited and just zipping through books one right after another. I can always have a ready supply on hand, so I never find myself without something interesting to read. Also, it's so simple to read in bed at night. Lightweight and easy to hold. Read with bedside lamp on or off, whichever you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding e-reader experience
customer_reviews.text: Make it brighter, make it bigger, make it bolder, make it better. Whatever you are reading Paper White gives you the option to change the display to provide comfortable reading for indoors, outdoors and changes in the font, Your entire downloaded Kindle library is always a couple of clicks away so that you can move from one book or document to another and easily return, picking up where you stopped the last time. The reader is about the size of a paperback book but much thinner and lighter, Read in a darkened room without disturbing others in the room with the convenient back lit setting. I am so happy with this I wish I had asked for one much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My wife has really sensitive eyes, and can't read books/magazines on Kindle Fires/iPads/etc. I figured we'd give this a shot, and she absolutely loves it. It's also nice that it syncs to our Amazon account just like our other devices, because I already had a few hundred books and they all showed up on her Paperwhite once she signed in. Another solid Amazon product.

customer_reviews.title: Great for improving your reading rates!

The technology on the screen really makes reading really easy on your eyes, and the texture is just amazing.

Nothing that software updates can't fix, but right now it only gets 3 stars.

customer_reviews.title: Love My New Kindle!

Since I got mine, I've ordered 2 more, one for my husband and one for my son. They love theirs as well. It's a great product!

customer_reviews.text: I cannot express how happy I am with this. When I was younger I was a voracious reader. As I grew older the text in books seemed to be getting more difficult to read. It was depressing and arduous. I purchased the Kindle Paperwhite and have been reading books again like I was a teenager. It is very easy to use. You can adjust text size to fit you comfort level and you can read in beautiful bright beach sunlight or just as easily in the comfort of your darkened room. There is nothing more beautiful than having thousands of books in a cargo pocket easily accessible. It weighs about the same as my cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a tablet for reading!
customer_reviews.text: I have been putting off buying a kindle for several years. I just couldn’t justify buying it when I could read on my phone or iPad. I ultimate purchased it because despite turning off all of the notifications on my phone, I still found myself on other apps rather than reading. I am so glad I finally made the decision to buy a kindle. It’s so much easier on the eyes to read than any other device. I thought I would’ve wanted it to have a night setting where the page and the text colors were inverted, but because the light isn’t shining in my eyes, it doesn’t mess with them in the dark.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to navigate

With help I was able to see my collections, but could not put them in alphabetical order - can you believe that!! User must find the smallest icons ever to use this Kindle and it is just full of crap, sorry. I am trashing this. I am so disappointed in this "upgrade". Why would anyone put their whole library on their Kindle, that is what your Amazon library is all about. What a waste of money and time and grief.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Snow

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Kindle, 3rd time it's broken beyond repair
customer_reviews.text: Had a Paperwhite for only a year and one day it just...froze. Wouldn't respond even to factory reset, and Amazon wouldn't replace since the warranty had only just run out-- just offered a 15% discount on a new one...which I'm sure will also just freeze up in a year. This is actually my 3rd Kindle. 2nd one died in a similar way, and my first had hardware break and also had to be replaced! Seems like these devices are just really delicate or poorly made and I won't be bothering to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Deep

customer_reviews.title: I was worried this would be a waste of money because I don't read a lot
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this would be a waste of money because I don't read a lot, but I actually find it helps me read more. It's so easy to find books I want to read and it's so lightweight, I can use it with just one hand. I love having my whole library on one little device that I can take anywhere. The battery lasts a really long time. The screen is easy to read. The only negative about this product is that it's not as dim in the dark as I would like. It still casts quite a bit of glow around the room even on one of the lowest settings.
customer_reviews.author: A Imbrogno

When I review my options for a new kindle - this one states-- "better battery life- longer- longer" I have not found this to be the case. Battery life is the same. If not a faster drain. Anyone else seeing this? Yes, in airplane mode it's longer but that much.... db ** after 3 months of use. The battery is NOT longer that past models....

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer

customer_reviews.title: Finally...
customer_reviews.text: I pushed off going e-book for a long while, however after receiving and using this kindle, all of my preconceptions were blown away. The size is good and the readability is perfect, especially in various lighting circumstances. Also like that I can now read without requiring a light, for example on night flights. The battery life is generally good. The only down is I'm not certain if I use it to it's full capabilities as I've never made the time to figure it out, other than basic reading of books.

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: I was given the Paperwhite as a Christmas present from my wife. On the 2nd day after charging the device I went in and changed the account information from her account to mine. On day 3 I decided to play with the device while watching football to see what e-books I could find and get familiar with my new reader. The device would not turn on, plugged it in and the computer would not recongnize the device. The device is dead. My wife is sending it back for a refund. I am not going to try another.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G.

customer_reviews.title: Limited
customer_reviews.text: The first book I downloaded onto the new Paperwhite was a travel guide to Portugal. I have spent a hour or so trying to figure it out. First, I do not understand how to navigate back and forth throughout the book, in a simple way, as one does with a travel guide. Second, I have not figured out how to use the maps that are on almost every page of the book. The device keeps telling me that I need a new browser, which I cannot download. I like the Kindle for reading a book from beginning to end. For using a more complicated format of a book, not so good. It's great if you stick to mystery stories.
customer_reviews.author: bwasow

customer_reviews.title: Works great for One Year
customer_reviews.text: Only lasts a year. This is the second Kindle I bought for my husband. First one lasted about 5 years. Second one I bought for him was this Paperwhite and he likes it - except the charging port began to malfunction after about 11 months and he's sick and tired of it not charging correctly for the last two months. Will buy him another and the warranty. Somewhere there must be a pile of dead Kindles a mile high - shame.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: The latest Kindle Paperwhite reader improves in all the right places.
customer_reviews.text: My first Kindle Paperwhite reader lasted six years and is still functional, so I got a good trade-in deal from Amazon for this new model. It responds more quickly, the image is super-sharp, and the interface has been condensed and improved in ways that save more time. I find myself reading more lately, as opposed to watching TV or DVD's for relaxation, and Kindle remains my best companion. A special "thank you" to my favorite authors (Catherine Bybee and Lisa Renee Jones top my list, although Grace Goodwin is closing in :-) for the hours of enjoyment I'm provided at a modest cost. Go Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: W. Corse

customer_reviews.text: I had wanted either a Kindle or a Nook for quite some time, not sure which to get. I talked to a number of people who almost all recommended the Kindle -- especially for it's ease of use and because there are so many titles available on Kindle. Once I finally was ready to get one, I decided on this Kindle and I can't share enough words to express how happy I am with that choice! It is EVERYTHING it is held out to be, and more. This is one of the best purchases I have made in a long time -- to think that something is actually BETTER than advertised is a wonderful thing!

customer_reviews.title: I can see it in the dark

I love how the screen adjusts to surrounding light and I never have to worry about seeing the screen at the beach or in my darkened bedroom. The battery is supposed to last weeks but mine only lasts days. I'll take a shortened battery life to have this amazing kindle because it charges quickly.

customer_reviews.author: Colin J. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Poor Uneven Lights
customer_reviews.text: Lights are Not Even. Dark on the lower Left & Bright on the lower Right. Hard to read on. I took Pictures & Darken them so you can see what I mean about the Lights being uneven. Like having a Spotlight or flashlight on lower Right & trying to read hiding from mom under a blanket! When I was a Kid it was Cool but now it just makes my eyes Hurt & Water! Surely this is Not Normal? UPDATE 3/20/2016 Received the New Replacement Yesterday! Works GREAT!! Yes even the lights are alright... spent ALL night Reading on it :) So I changed it to 5 ***** Stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara1955

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Weight, Shape and Size for a Rheumatoid Arthritis Sufferer
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a voracious reader. She also suffers from severe rheumatoid arthritis. So, when my son and I were on the lookout for a new Kindle for her we did a lot of homework. Just about the time we were ready to make a buy along comes Amazon with better pricing. Bonus! Much lighter than her earlier model, this now being her third Kindle. Watching her now reading in bed I can see how much better this is for her. The luminescence is much brighter and crisper. She's holding it by the tips of her fingers on her left hand. That's a testament to the lightweightedness of the unit. We are certainly pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: A must have for book lovers who travel often
customer_reviews.text: The paperwhite is insanely amazing! All the new features that come in this paperwhite make it my favorite e-reader thus far. I love how long the battery lasts, The back light for night reading and the fact that I can read this in the day with no glare. It is so lightweight and essy to use that I think it is a solid investment for every avid book lover and traveler. The only thinf K wish it had was the capacity to show color. I’m not sure if that tech is available yet for this lind of e-reader, so I’ll sit tight and enjoy this one until they make a paperwhite with color.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: I resisted for many years, but in the age of living simple and downsizing I caved
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite device. I have stopped trying to store books and only have about ten on my shelves. i read book after book and am giddy with all the choices. This version froze on me once and it was not simple to figure out how to fix it. so if it happens plug it in and wait awhile then do the holding of the start button and do not always keep it on charger. i love this product and the ability to change the font and know how much i have read.
customer_reviews.author: EMQ

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this. It is the older paperwhite and everything functions as it is supposed to. Battery lasts an incredibly long time. I don't know why so many people have posted about a short battery life. It seems that I am charging it every week and I use this daily. My old kindle from 2011 had to be charged every few days so this is a huge improvement. Purchased on black friday for $79.99. Buy the newest version unless this is on sale. I saw the newest paperwhite for $99.99 and this unit is $119.99 at the time of this review.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Goldblatt

customer_reviews.title: Good as long as it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle worked well and I enjoyed it very much since December 2017 . However, this morning(03/27/2019) I tried to continue reading my story and it would not respond. The only signs of life was a full page ad for a book and the green light(which should indicate a charged battery). I does not respond to the control at all. I will contact Amazon, but it is out of warranty and so I paid $115 for the use of a kindle for little more than a year plus paid for the content of the material read in the device. If I get a better response than I expect from Amazon, I will revisit this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good hardware, terrible software, bad ui. Especially bad for manga
customer_reviews.text: The price on this is quite decent. the backlight is very nice, page movement is fast. But the UI is insanely bad. I kind of like it. But I'll probably return it. Very poorly optimized for manga. No title information for your books, just the cover page. going to the next book takes a minimum of 5 clicks. For manga that are split up by chapter this is really irritating. some manga randomly put you to zoom in or go to a editing mode. organizing the books is a nightmare. garbage books you can't seem to delete.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A few issues
customer_reviews.text: I love my kindle paperwhite, but I have a few issues. First, I hate that it highlights text instead of underlining text. My old kindle 3 would underline text. To me, it just looks neater. Second, this kindle scratches too easily. I have it in a nice leather case (from Amazon). Still, every time I turn around there's another scratch on this thing. Below is edited after several months of use: The battery life is short as well. I feel like I'm charging it every other day.
customer_reviews.author: mslb

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy on the eyes
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Paperwhite is light to hold, and the backlight is brilliant. It's definitely more glare-free than my tablet. The print is easy to read, and very clear at 300 ppi. Having said that, I do wish the Paperwhite had a quick way to check battery life while I'm reading other than by trying to open the top menu, which doesn't always open easily. The screen is not quite as touch sensitive as I'm accustomed to with a tablet or smartphone. After charging the Kindle initially, the process of downloading my library and customizing settings drained the battery far faster than I anticipated, and without that ready visual, the battery discharged fully without my realizing.
customer_reviews.author: Morwen Navarre

customer_reviews.title: bring back the Kindle Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I do like the paperwhite as it is small and easy to carry in my handbag but I find that it is not as good as my keyboard edition because if I were able tp easily hold a book and turn the pages, I would read book in print editions. The keyboard machine can be set up to be read while lying down and the page turn is accomplished by pushing a button. On a paperwhite one must flip pages by swiping the screen and it is possible to accidently reset other screen managed options. I am handicapped and much prefer the way the keyboard kindle handles.
customer_reviews.author: paulebird

customer_reviews.title: A positive review from a Kindle convert!
customer_reviews.text: I had always claimed that I would not read a book on a device; turns out I was wrong. I only gave in to Kindle because we were sheltering in place during the pandemic. I ordered a refurbished Kindle Paperwhite because it was cheap. I am enjoying it! I especially like downloading free books from the public library. The Paperwhite has great light; the print size is fine; it’s comfortable in my hand; I like touching the screen to advance the page. The built-in bookmark is quite handy. The battery is strong. Don’t stay stuck in your ways; try a Kindle!
customer_reviews.author: Daria Pogan

customer_reviews.title: If you play games on your Kindle, don't get a new one!
customer_reviews.text: If you like to play games on your Kindle, then don't purchase anything newer than 6th generation. Amazon decided that we should only be allowed to read on our devices, after that. I found this out the hard way. Sent it back and purchased a used one. Made me pretty mad, actually! Their customer service is all done from some foreign country where English is NOT their first language! A very frustrating experience!
customer_reviews.author: J. Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Good product but software can be lacking if you are not using strictly Amazon
customer_reviews.text: First off, I enjoy the Kindle itself... but I have some ebooks that I've bought for work or grabbed when they are cheap or free from publishers. Putting them on the Kindle requires me to convert them. Not a huge deal, but I don't really feel that is the best consumer experience. Also, if you want to organize your non-Amazon collection you will need to jail-break your Kindle, which would invalidate your warranty and seems to actually be impossible if you have a firmware above a certain version. So mainly my gripes are with the consumer unfriendly functions and software.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Blotches at bottom of screen
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I have discovered that, for me, the Paperwhite doesn't live up to the hype. There are noticeable gray blotches at the bottom of the screen, and even though they may not interfere with the actual text you're reading, they are noticeable nonetheless. It is particularly annoying because of the advertising hype given to the great screen experience. Sorry, but it ain't that great. I'll probably keep the device, as I got in on sale for $79.99, and it is convenient to be able to store so many Kindle books on it, despite their relatively high cost. But I won't purchase another device like this without some hands-on time with it first. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Unable to handle library books
customer_reviews.text: High quality reader. Unfortunately it has a big problem for me: IT CANNOT DOWNLOAD E-BOOKS FROM MY LIBRARY ! Most library systems nowadays, including the one I belong to, require the installation of an App in order to download E-books. Kindle E-reader does not support any App. Therefore I decided to install the library App on my iPad and iPhone and returned the E-reader. My recommendation: if your library system supports multiple libraries -- mine includes over 80 libraries -- chances are there will be a lot of electronic books to your liking for you to borrow for free when you use a smart phone or a tablet. Otherwise Kindle E-reader is a fine choice.
customer_reviews.author: Mannie

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The device is almost flawless. The screen is great, the battery life is outstanding, the software works without glitches. The only small thing that I thing what should be fixed is the background lighting - it is on even what you set it to the lowest setting, there is no actual way of turning it off. But the battery life is still great - so that’s not a real problem.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Sync Seamlessly Across All Devices
customer_reviews.text: This device consistently fails to sync properly to the furthest page read as well as failing to sync notes and highlights. I have whispersync turned on across all of my devices and kindle apps and I even manually sync every time I read because whispersync fails to work reliably. When I try to switch from the kindle app from ios to the kindle device, the kindle device always open to the first page, does not have my notes and highlights, and tells me that the first page is my furthest page read. It does not work as advertised. I have tried every troubleshooting recommendation too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reader
customer_reviews.text: I have been using readers for years. A friend suggested I try the Kindle since I have been using my Samsung tablet for a reader. I found that I can not only read faster, the strain on my eyes is much less and the best part is the battery life. I charged the book when I first got it. 4 weeks later I needed to recharge after reading 7 books. WOW, that is great since I used to have to charge my tablet daily or twice daily. Another thing I like is the fact it fits in my purse and it is easy to carry. The light feature make it easy to read in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Rzr Girl

customer_reviews.title: Newest model is way too bright. Second time I've bought this.
customer_reviews.text: I had this one and loved it. Bought the newest Paperwhite (10th Ed) and hated it. I love the dimmest setting on this ereader. It's wonderful. I can blow up the text late at night and read it on the lowest light setting. The 10th edition is SO BRIGHT! My older one was recently stolen... It worked great. So I came back and bought the same one again. I've included pictures of the lowest settings on both, as well as the dark mode on the newest model. Literally worthless for me. If you're sensitive to light, this older model is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: GTHam

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Paperwhite E-Reader - Easy to read for many hours of enjoyment with white light
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for several years for improvements in the Kindle readers. Finally, this Kindle Paperwhite E-reader is Easy to read for many hours of enjoyment with white light background on your eyes. Easy to use dictionary, if you don't recognize the words. easy to build ones vocabulary. Automatically attaches a bookmarked so you can find your starting point after putting the book down for a day or two. Easy to download thousands of books from Amazon and even more if you purchase an Amazon Prime subscription for a year. Millions of books are also available for purchasing on Kindle Unlimited subscriptions. Love the Kinda Paperwhite E-Reader
customer_reviews.author: sdbowe33

customer_reviews.title: Not Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I received this for Christmas and so far I am not thrilled with it. There is no easily accessible Users Guide and I am constantly trying to look up information on my computer.. Even then It will tell me something like "Go to content and devices" without telling me how to get there. Some help guides talk about the "Cloud" but I don't see that anywhere on my Paperwhite. If I don't figure things out soon I'll probably go back to regular books like I have always read. I even asked for help from my local library and was told that the Paperwhite is harder to use than using a Fire. I wish I had known that before.
customer_reviews.author: Sharonf

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, the touch screen is not too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The good thing about this kindle is that its battery life is quite amazing, it could easily last for a couple of weeks with once it's fully charged. The thing I dislike is the touch screen, as time goes on, it slowly started to get not very sensitive, causing the user to tap on the screen multiple times in rare cases.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a year
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed my Kindle for a year, and then I had a problem. It would not turn on, even after charging, even after holding the button down. Unfortunately, the user guide is accessed by using the device, so my husband had to google how to resolve the issue. This was resolved by holding the button for a long time, 45 seconds to a minute. Now it works fine. Today, a gentleman from tech support called me about this issue. He was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: CreepingJennie

customer_reviews.title: I'm Light Sensitive and Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have had this now for over 6 months. I love it. I am light sensitive and have a hard time reading on a computer or my Samsung tablet. A friend recommended this, and it works so well. I do not use it for any book where pictures would be needed for illustrations such as gardening, crafting (crochet, knitting, etc.), and what not, but it works well for novels. You can adjust the brightness and other settings. I bought a case Fintie Folio Case for this as it feels quite thin, and I was afraid of dropping it. Once I got that, it feels just like a paperback novel. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: DaBoujibo

customer_reviews.title: Great for trips and at home
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Kindle Fire before, but I like this one better because it's smaller and lighter. The built in screen light makes it easy to read on a plane after lights are turned off at night. The battery lasts longer than the Fire, too, because it doesn't do anything except store e-books. It fits easily into my purse and weighs almost nothing. This is a refurbished model -- so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Divascribe

customer_reviews.title: A life-changing product, seriously
customer_reviews.text: Never had an E-book reader before -- in fact, scoffed at the very idea when the Kindles were introduced. But to be able to have a couple of million different books delivered in minutes, with all of them together weighing less than a pound, is life-altering. The entire act of reading has been reinvented. The biggest surprise is the concept of E-ink: it's actual ink, but sort of electronically controlled. This means that bright sunlight just makes it easier to see the screen: the reader has little LED's inside it for nighttime reading. Lasts me like two weeks on a charge, too.
customer_reviews.author: Teh Arbitrageur

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Kindle keeps me away from distractions and I love the dictionary feature. I am not a native speaker so when I read a paper book, it might take me forever to go back and forth to my computer to translate and that's what makes me get distracted. With Kindle, I can look up for the word meaning and then I can easily understand the full context of what the author is saying. And the best thing is my eyes won't hurt after reading on Kindle. If I read on my iPhone, my eyes hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Cong Do Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I Love My New Kindle!
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted with my first Kindle and it came with a case that had a light. The fact that it turned itself off after disuse of a few minutes was great for someone who reads in bed and falls asleep. My new Kindle has the light feature built into it, so my new cover was strictly for protection. Wow! It's easy to carry/store/use and with a bright cover, it is easy to locate. I rarely misplace it.  I miss the books that were already bought and loaded on my old Kindle by it's original purchaser, but I greatly enjoy the new features of my new one. Congratulations on a well-designed product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: A Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I despise the interface on this device. I use the Kindle to replace a book: when I turn it on, it should open at the page I was reading. When I want to find a book, I want to go to my collections which do not change. The library system and blurry and intrusive reading lists, difficulty adding to collections and upload download from somewhere ruins my reading experience. What I wanted was an upgrade of my old Kindle which acted more like a book; a longer lasting battery, brighter display. What I got was a system which insinuates itself so that I am clicking and pushing on the device rather than enjoying the content I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: the browser is almost useless. But that's not what it's made for
customer_reviews.text: I now understand why folks buy one of these vs a Kindle Fire. There are strong uses cases for having both, actually. You're not going to watch videos, install apps or surf the web on this unit. Although, it does come with an "experimental browser", the browser is almost useless. But that's not what it's made for. Its purpose is to read on, night or day. Even on a very bright day, it's very easy to read on. The flashing that happens when scrolling or changing pages is a bit annoying. But that's probably because of the technology of epaper hasn't advanced beyond this, yet.
customer_reviews.author: JA Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love that it doesn't die in a day. I've had a Kindle Fire since they came out and always loved it but the glare from the screen has started bothering me. Plus, I never used it outside of reading so I wanted to give the Paperwhite a try. I love that it mimics what reading a paperback book would be like and that it has the light so I don't have to use my lamp while reading. It's lightweight and easy to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblings From This Chick

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Lasted Longer
customer_reviews.text: While it worked, this was a great reader. It was a vast improvement over my 2nd generation reader, and it served me reasonably well. My complaint is that with minimal use (basically only on vacations and travel), it didn't have much of a life to it. I find it interesting that my earlier Kindle is still going strong (used by my son) while this newer version died in two years. While it still looks brand new (I took great care of it), it no longer works, even with a new battery installed.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Puffing on the no-pay "Internet" connection feature
customer_reviews.text: The way that Amazon advertised this is that Kindle Paper White is always connected online to allow for instant downloads, etc. Well, actually, there is theoretically some number of hot spots which you could ad hoc configure to connect with, but I've never seen them. So, the user experience is that the Paper White is just as desperate to use my WiFi connection as any other Kindle I've owned has been. Booh! Amazon, you shouldn't tout a feature that is seldom available to most of your users in the normal course of usage. It sets them up to be very Under-whelmed. It's just good business to under-promise and over-deliver than to do the opposite.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a fire and this new paperwhite (well, new when I bought it earlier this year). Unlike the claims Amazon makes, it does not hold the charge for weeks (because I use it a lot), but it does last a lot longer than my fire, and it charges fast--from dead to full power in an hour. I would like charge claims to actually state how many hours a charge lasts on all Kindle products because everyone's reading habits are different. A few things I especially like is that it's easier to delete a book from the home page and the covers that automatically turn it on/off. I'm glad I upgraded, am happy with my paperwhite and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat H

customer_reviews.title: This worked well and now does not! AMAZON IS A THIEF.
customer_reviews.text: Help! My name is Anna Rayne-Levi. I bought a Kindle from Amazon last year and it is now not working. It accepts my code but then does not allow me go swipe to open! I just bought a book on Kindle from AMAZON and I CANNOT OPEN MY KINDLE TO ACCESS IT! My bank was charged for the book. If this is not resolved in 48 hours, I am contacting the FBI Fraud Dept. and my attorney. My family owns Time-Warner & Six Flags and we are NOT HAPPY! Anna Rayne-Levi (nee Edelbrock)
customer_reviews.author: A. Rayne-Levi

customer_reviews.title: Improved My Kid's attention to reading
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice product. My kid carries it to school on daily basis now. It increased my kid's attention to reading time and skills. I removed one star as the menu and response time is sometimes frustrating in addition to the feeling of the screen not fully smooth to the touch. I have also subscribed to Amazon "freetime" which is generally good but disappointing when it comes to availability of some services overseas when linked to EchoDot. As I realize this is not an EchoDot review, I did not knock down additional stars but thought important to highlight.
customer_reviews.author: O. Itani

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this replacement Kindle for about two years, and so far it hasn't broken down like my others have. Amazon ought to put more than a 1-year warranty on their e-readers. But having said that, I love these e-readers and the vast amount of space it saves by storing books there. It is easy to read, but I wish they offered bigger fonts than the 14-point currently offered. Also, you should be able to share books with more than one person; with physical books, ypu can lend them out as often as you want.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn K. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: for the nighttime reading capabilities and this does not disappoint! It is very lightweight and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: My original Kindle died - wouldn't hold a charge any longer, but after 6 years of hard use, it was to be expected. I went with the Paperwhite, for the nighttime reading capabilities and this does not disappoint! It is very lightweight and easy to read. The one drawback is that you have to individually download each of your books from your personal library, if you are replacing an older Kindle, and this can take a lot of time. I have over 400 books stored on my Kindle, so this process took a couple of hours. Other than that, it is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Paperwhite Kindle is so much better than the old models
customer_reviews.text: This Paperwhite Kindle is so much better than the old models. It is easy on the eyes and does not need constant re-charging. Its battery lasts a much longer time. Makes reading any book on it a pleasure. It can hold many books, somewhat like carrying a library around with you. It is very light weight and comfortable to hold.Text is sharp and most of the time adjustable in size. Personal documents in PDF format may not always have adjustable text size..
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great device, go paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome device, if you're between a paperwhite and a regular kindle do yourself a favor and get the paperwhite. The backlighting is a killer feature, and it's much better than digital screens where it's simply too bright. The one place where I knock the kindle is the response time of the "ink". Being spoiled by the lightning fast refresh rates on other digital devices, the delay on page turning is quite noticeable (700ms to 1000ms) for the next page to replace the previous page. This isn't detrimental to the product unless you are a speed reader and at that point, this product probably isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Siah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to read, little to no glare! Capacity of more than 3k books!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Kindle so much. It’s inspired me to actually want to read, and I’ve been reading a lot lately. It looks amazing, sometimes even like actual paper. The letters display resolution is fantastic, and I’m able to highlight, take notes on anything, and easily flip through pages. It also has a dictionary that works to define every single word, even without LTE or Wifi. It holds soo many books (over 3k) and in my opinion definitely replaces books. Aside from the beautiful covers, and smells de oages of the books hold. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Yamichelle

customer_reviews.title: Superb reading experience, awful internet
customer_reviews.text: The reading experience on the Paperwhite is an absolute delight - no electronics blaring at you makes such a difference. The battery life is truly amazing: easily three weeks with half-time light use. Buying and downloading new books is extremely easy. The available fonts, text sizes, and other settings are very easy to find and adjust. There are two major downsides. Navigating books can be extremely cumbersome since the Paperwhite doesn't care about pages. And the "Experimental Web Browser" is shockingly bad. I have yet to be able to use wireless that has a web login involved because the browser doesn't handle JavaScript well, and crashes regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M

customer_reviews.title: my favorite purchase of the year.
customer_reviews.text: best purchase of the year!!! i can't put it down. i'm reading all the time now. i am partially dyslexic so sometimes it's hard for me to stay on the same line and this text formatting is perfect for me. i can read with so much more ease now. i thought i wouldn't need the light up screen but i change my mind and am so happy that i got the paperwhite. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: A military deployment must have!
customer_reviews.text: You'll get bored on a deployment and want to do something besides watch The Office a hundred times. If you enjoy books then I highly recommend picking one up. I absolutely love my kindle and I look forward to each night reading before bed. The battery really does last for weeks on one charge. It's seriously a must have on a deployment! Had some issues sending the kindle paperwhite to my APO so I just shipped it to the states and then to deployed location.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: All-New Kindle Paperwhite <3
customer_reviews.text: Had initial trouble (Error - Internal Error) but I got it quickly resolved through a customer service call. The product is flawless otherwise. The biggest reason I got this is because I didn't want eyestrain. The ink technology works like an etch-a-sketch and it looks like I'm actually reading a book on paper (minus the weight haha). Love it so far. 5 out of 5, would buy again. My Kindle has stopped responding to my touch. I am so sad because it has died today on October 6th, 2017. I would like a new Kindle please!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Parker

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kindle !
customer_reviews.text: I love reading books from my Kindle at night, in the car, or outside. The screen lends itself to easy viewing no matter where I may be. I was delighted with the ease of ordering my new one and with the auto download of all the books on my old one. It even took me right back to the location in the book I was reading when my old one crashed.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Sv

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good, just not great.
customer_reviews.text: Got a Kindle paperwhite E-Reader, WiFi w/ads to replace my old Gen. 2 Kindle which died. Prior to getting this one I was using the Kindle app on my iPad and it worked great. The drawback is that the iPad is heavier and more tiresome to hold. This new Kindle takes some getting used to and some setting tweaks to make it readable. You've got to experiment with all of the settings to see what works for you. I wish the Kindle's user controls were as good as they are in the Kindle app on my iPad. The Prime Day deal made it attractive enough to jump on, but I would never pay the full retail price for one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: VERY FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a kindle paperwhite for a while; haven't used it much, preferring books to digital text; but it's easier to carry so I decided to try again to overcome the frustration of not being able to remove Samples, for instance, of difficulty with knowing where I am in the text, etc. Today, I tried to register it, as I have the app on my iPhone. That was simple; it was impossible on the Kindle, using the Amazon account address and password. ...If ever there is an update to the Paperwhite with a good keyboard, I'll try again, especially if there is a simple way of removing samples, already read or not wanted.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyR

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I read more now that I can carry a large collection of my books with me. This is small, light and compact. It doesn’t give off a glare and it’s easy on my eyes. I love and use mine so much, I purchased one for my 12-year-old. We check out books from the library for her and she is pleased. I feel so happy when I see her reading her Kindle. It is very convenient. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Price

customer_reviews.title: Bought "Used - Very Good" and it looks perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I decided i wanted to buy my first kindle hoping it would get me reading more and I couldn't be happier. I was deciding between this model and the newest 2018 paperwhite. After doing some research and comparisons I decided I would prefer some of the features on this model more (specifically the black kindle logo and the indented screen!) I was pleased to see under buying options I could get a Used version of the device for only $81. When it came it looked brand new and has been working perfectly! So pleased with my purchase!
